alert.note: Alert for Blackfoot Mountains; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Marsh and Arbon Highlands (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 05 at 6:08AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG WILL AFFECT WEST CENTRAL CARIBOU...SOUTHEASTERN BANNOCK AND SOUTHWESTERN FRANKLIN COUNTIES... Patchy dense fog has been detected on highways south of Pocatello on Idaho Transportation Department cameras. This includes U S Route 91 from the Portneuf Gap south to the Utah border, and U S Route 30 from McCammon to east of Lava Hot Springs. The visibility has been recorded by instruments to be just a few hundred feet at times on these roads. The threat of fog is expected to last through at least 8 am this morning. The reduced visibility makes driving hazardous, lengthening the amount of time and distance required to recognize a hazard in the road and take action. Locations impacted include... Preston, McCammon, Lava Hot Springs, Swanlake, Inkom, Franklin, Downey, Arimo, Virginia, Clifton, Oxford, and Whitney. Visibilities are below one quarter of a mile in the fog. If you are driving, slow down and be on alert for other motorists. Low visibility shortens the amount of time you have to react to situations.

area.areaDesc: Blackfoot Mountains; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Marsh and Arbon Highlands
